importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The start date of Kevin Federline's relationship with Britney Spears, marking the beginning of a high-profile celebrity couple and media frenzy.
The year Britney Spears published her own memoir, providing context for the public discourse and narrative balance in the media surrounding her life and relationship with Federline.
The publication date of Kevin Federline's memoir, 'You Thought You Knew,' which marks a pivotal moment in the ongoing public dialogue about Britney Spears' life and mental health.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the relationship between Kevin Federline and Britney Spears was in its peak public visibility, including their wedding, media scrutiny, and early public disputes.
The time between the end of the peak media frenzy and Spears' memoir release, during which public perception of her mental health and behavior continued to evolve.
The period during which Federline's memoir was being prepared and released, signaling a new phase in the public narrative involving accountability, co-parenting, and mental health advocacy.

keyTakeAways: Kevin Federline's memoir, 'You Thought You Knew,' is being released on the audiobook platform Listenin, signaling a new stage in public discourse around the Spears-Federline relationship.
Federline expresses deep concern for his two sons, Preston and Jayden, and cites their well-being as the primary motivation for sharing his experiences with Britney Spears.

The memoir includes controversial and potentially disturbing details about Spears’ behavior, such as her drinking during pregnancy, use of cocaine while breastfeeding, and alleged incidents of violence toward her sons.

Spears responded to the memoir by accusing Federline of gaslighting and claiming he misrepresented her mental health and personal life, emphasizing that fans' focus on tabloid narratives has harmed her reputation.

Federline criticizes the 'Free Britney' movement, arguing it created a hostile environment that vilified her supporters and co-parents, and expresses hope for Spears' peace despite his belief that progress has stalled.
The memoir reveals intimate details of their early relationship, including the first night they met and the emotional shock of being followed by paparazzi after a hotel encounter.
Federline reflects on his own journey as a dancer, artist, and father, and underscores the importance of transparency to protect his children’s future.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Federline
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former husband and co-parent of Britney Spears; author of the memoir 'You Thought You Knew'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Federline's memoir offers a personal, firsthand account of his relationship with Britney Spears and the impact on his children, particularly as a father navigating complex co-parenting dynamics.

namedEntities.name: Britney Spears
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former wife of Kevin Federline; public figure whose life and mental health have been the subject of media scrutiny.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The central figure in the relationship narrative, whose actions and public statements are directly challenged and described in Federline’s memoir, fueling ongoing media and public debate about her behavior and mental health.

namedEntities.name: Preston Spears
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of Britney Spears and Kevin Federline, aged 20 at the time of the article.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: One of the two sons who have distanced themselves from their mother, with Federline citing traumatic stories from him that influenced his decision to write the memoir.

namedEntities.name: Jayden Spears
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of Britney Spears and Kevin Federline, aged 19 at the time of the article.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The other son who has distanced himself from his mother, with Federline citing traumatic experiences and stories that contributed to his decision to share his story publicly.

namedEntities.name: Justin Timberlake
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former partner of Britney Spears; mentioned in the context of Spears' emotional attachment to him.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Serves as a reference point for Spears' emotional history, illustrating her unresolved feelings that Federline claims influenced her behavior during the marriage.

namedEntities.name: Listenin
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Audiobook platform where Kevin Federline's memoir 'You Thought You Knew' will be released.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The platform indicates a shift toward accessible, digital media consumption of personal narratives, especially in emotionally charged celebrity stories.

namedEntities.name: Free Britney Movement
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Public campaign advocating for the removal of Britney Spears’ court conservatorship.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Federline criticizes this movement as having created a hostile, vilifying environment that harmed both Spears and her co-parents, highlighting the broader societal impact of such movements.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Kevin Federline, former husband and co-parent of Britney Spears, has released a memoir titled 'You Thought You Knew,' detailing his tumultuous relationship with Spears, including intimate and controversial accounts of her behavior such as drinking during pregnancy, cocaine use while breastfeeding, and alleged incidents of violence toward her sons. The memoir, released on the audiobook platform Listenin, is driven by his deep concern for the well-being of his two sons, Preston and Jayden, who have distanced themselves from Spears and have shared traumatic stories. Federline describes the emotional and media chaos of their relationship, including early courtship and public scrutiny, and criticizes the 'Free Britney' movement for creating a hostile environment that vilified Spears and her supporters. Spears responded by accusing Federline of gaslighting and claiming his portrayal of her mental health is false. Federline, while critical of the public narrative, expresses a hope for Spears' peace and recovery.
title: Kevin Federline Releases Memoir Detailing Controversial Relationship with Britney Spears
